channel.title: Alan's Blog
channel.description: A blog about programming and other miscellaneous topics.

item.title: How to Create and Host Your First Website With GitHub | February 6, 2022 | 4 min read
item.description: In this article I'll teach you how to create your very own website and host it through GitHub completely for free. Let's get started!

item.title: Creating Aliases on Linux and Mac | January 12, 2021 | 2 min read
item.description: Are you tired of typing long commands into the terminal? Did you misremember a flag causing an error making you pull out your hair for 2 minutes only to realize that flag doesn't exist? Well worry no more because I'll be showing you how to create aliases for all of those pesky hard-to-remember commands.

item.title: Creating Your Own Deepfakes Without Coding Experience | August 13, 2020 | 6 min read
item.description: Creating your own deepfakes has been possible for a while now but the problem was that it required a lot of data, computing power, and time. But now, thanks to several AI researchers, we are now able to create deepfakes with a single image. Better yet, not only can we create deepfakes with a single image, but they also don't take hours or days to make, now they take only mere onds and at most a couple of minutes.

item.title: Water Your Plant Using a Raspberry Pi and Python | March 10, 2020 | 8 min read
item.description: I suck at taking care of plants, mostly because I forget to water them. So then I started thinking, "I'm sure someone out there has figured out a way to automate this process." Turns out, there are plenty of people who have. Namely in the form of using an Arduino or a Raspberry Pi to automatically water their plants. In this post, I'll be talking about how I used a Raspberry Pi and Python to automatically water my plant.

item.title: Keep the Footer at the Bottom | February 22, 2020 | 11 min read
item.description: How do we keep that pesky footer at the bottom? Well, today I'll be showcasing three solutions to this problem. The first and simplest solution is using flexbox, the second solution is using grid, and the final solution is using a wrapper. Alright, let's get started.

item.title: 5 Simple-To-Use APIs for Beginners | February 9, 2020 | 6 min read
item.description: In this article I'll be talking about five simple-to-use APIs to help inspire project ideas. The goal of this post is to inspire you to create a project, whether it be simple or complex, and start using APIs.

item.title: Creating a Discord Bot With Python | February 1, 2020 | 7 min read
item.description: In this article we'll create a Discord bot using Python. The bot we'll be creating today will have a simple purpose, telling jokes. We will give the bot a command and it will return a random joke. This should be simple enough, let's get started!

item.title: Getting Started With the Terminal | January 12, 2020 | 16 min read
item.description: So, you want to learn how to use the Terminal. Great! As a developer, sooner or later, youâ€™ll want to learn how to use the Terminal. Not only is this a handy tool to have under your belt, but it will also boost your productivity.
